   17: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------
   18: %% @author Maxim Fedorov <maximfca@gmail.com>
   19: %% Basic process tracing profiler tests.
   20: -module(tprof_SUITE).
   21: -author("maximfca@gmail.com").
   22: 
   23: %% Test server callbacks
   24: -export([suite/0, all/0, groups/0,
   25:          init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2]).
   26: 
   27: %% Test cases exports
   28: -export([
   29:     call_count_ad_hoc/0, call_count_ad_hoc/1,
   30:     call_time_ad_hoc/0, call_time_ad_hoc/1,
   31:     call_memory_ad_hoc/0, call_memory_ad_hoc/1,
   32:     lists_seq_loop/1, call_memory_total/1,
   33:     sort/0, sort/1,
   34:     rootset/0, rootset/1,
   35:     set_on_spawn/0, set_on_spawn/1, seq/1,
   36:     live_trace/0, live_trace/1,
   37:     patterns/0, patterns/1, pattern_fun/1, pattern_fun/2, pattern_fun/3,
   38:     processes/0, processes/1,
   39:     server/0, server/1,
   40:     hierarchy/0, hierarchy/1,
   41:     code_reload/0, code_reload/1,
   42:     code_load/0, code_load/1
   43: ]).
   44: 
   45: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   46: 
   47: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   48: %% COMMON TEST CALLBACK FUNCTIONS
   49: 
   50: suite() ->
   51:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 60}}].
   52: 
   53: all() ->
   54:     [call_count_ad_hoc, %% Cannot be run in parallel
   55:      {group, all}].
   56: 
   57: groups() ->
   58:     [{all, [parallel], [call_time_ad_hoc, call_memory_ad_hoc,
   59:                         call_memory_total, sort, rootset, set_on_spawn,
   60:                         code_load, code_reload,
   61:                         {group, default_session},
   62:                         {group, custom_session}]},
   63:      {default_session,[],session()},
   64:      {custom_session,[parallel],session()}].
   65: 
   66: init_per_group(custom_session, Config) ->
   67:     [{session, ?MODULE} | Config];
   68: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
   69:     Config.
   70: 
   71: end_per_group(_, Config) ->
   72:     Config.
   73: 
   74: session() ->
   75:     [live_trace, patterns, processes, server, hierarchy].
   76: 
   77: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   78: %% TEST CASES
   79: 
   80: call_count_ad_hoc() ->
   81:     [{doc, "Ad-hoc examples for call_count measurement"}].
   82: 
   83: call_count_ad_hoc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   84:     ct:capture_start(),
   85:     ok = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 16]),
   86:     ct:capture_stop(),
   87:     Output = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
   88: 
   89:     %% We check that only the things profiled are lists:seq/2 and lists:seq_loop/3
   90:     %% and that the output looks good
   91:     ?assertMatch(
   92:        ["FUNCTION          CALLS  [    %]",
   93:         "lists:seq/2           1  ["++_,
   94:         "lists:seq_loop/3      5  ["++_,
   95:         "                         [100.0]"], Output),
   96: 
   97:     %% spawn examples
   98:     SpawnFun =
   99:         fun () ->
  100:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
  101:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
  102:        end,
  103:     %% trace subset examples
  104:     {done, Profile1} = tprof:profile(SpawnFun, #{pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}], report => return, type => call_count}),
  105:     ?assertMatch({call_count, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{all, _, _}]}]}, Profile1),
  106: 
  107:     %% timer
  108:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, Profile2} = tprof:profile(
  109:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), receive after Delay -> ok end end,
  110:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_count }),
  111:     ?assertMatch({call_count, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, _}]},
  112:                                {lists, seq, 2, [{_, 1, _}]},
  113:                                {?MODULE, _, _, _}
  114:                               ]}, Profile2),
  115: 
  116:     %% timer with patterns
  117:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, Profile3} = tprof:profile(
  118:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), timer:sleep(Delay) end,
  119:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_count,
  120:           pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}]}),
  121:     ?assertMatch({call_count, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{all, _, _}]}]}, Profile3).
  122: 
  123: call_time_ad_hoc() ->
  124:     [{doc, "Ad-hoc examples for call_time measurement"}].
  125: 
  126: call_time_ad_hoc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  127:     ct:capture_start(),
  128:     ok = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 1000], #{type => call_time}),
  129:     ct:capture_stop(),
  130:     Output = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
  131: 
  132:     %% We check that only the things profiled are lists:seq/2 and lists:seq_loop/3
  133:     ?assertMatch(
  134:        ["****** Process "++_,
  135:         "FUNCTION          CALLS  TIME"++_,
  136:         "lists:seq/2           1       "++_,
  137:         "lists:seq_loop/3    251       "++_,
  138:         "                              "++_],
  139:        Output),
  140: 
  141:     %% spawn examples
  142:     SpawnFun =
  143:         fun () ->
  144:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
  145:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
  146:        end,
  147:     %% trace subset examples
  148:     {done, Profile1} = tprof:profile(SpawnFun, #{pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}], report => return, type => call_time}),
  149:     ?assertMatch({call_time, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, _}]}]}, Profile1),
  150: 
  151:     %% timer
  152:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, Profile2} = tprof:profile(
  153:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), receive after Delay -> ok end end,
  154:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_time }),
  155:     ?assertMatch({call_time, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, _}]},
  156:                               {lists, seq, 2, [{_, 1, _}]},
  157:                               {?MODULE, _, _, _}
  158:                              ]}, Profile2),
  159: 
  160:     %% timer with filter
  161:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, Profile3} = tprof:profile(
  162:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), timer:sleep(Delay) end,
  163:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_time,
  164:           pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}]}),
  165:     ?assertMatch({call_time, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, _}]}]}, Profile3).
  166: 
  167: call_memory_ad_hoc() ->
  168:     [{doc, "Ad-hoc examples for call_memory measurement"}].
  169: 
  170: call_memory_ad_hoc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  171:     ct:capture_start(),
  172:     ok = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 16], #{type => call_memory}),
  173:     ct:capture_stop(),
  174:     Output = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
  175:     %% We check that only the things profiled are lists:seq/2 and lists:seq_loop/3
  176:     %% and that the output looks good
  177:     ?assertMatch(
  178:        ["****** Process "++_,
  179:         "FUNCTION          CALLS  WORDS  PER CALL  [     %]",
  180:         "lists:seq_loop/3      5     32      6.40  [100.00]",
  181:         "                            32            [ 100.0]"], Output),
  182:     %% spawn examples
  183:     SpawnFun =
  184:         fun () ->
  185:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
  186:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
  187:        end,
  188:     %% trace subset examples
  189:     {done, Profile1} = tprof:profile(SpawnFun, #{pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}], report => return, type => call_memory}),
  190:     ?assertMatch({call_memory, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, 64}]}]}, Profile1),
  191:     %% timer
  192:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, Profile2} = tprof:profile(
  193:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), timer:sleep(Delay) end,
  194:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_memory}),
  195:     ?assertMatch({call_memory, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, 64}]}]}, Profile2).
  196: 
  197: lists_seq_loop(N) ->
  198:     [int_to_bin_twice(M) || M <- lists:seq(1, N)].
  199: 
  200: int_to_bin_twice(M) ->
  201:     B = integer_to_binary(M),
  202:     <<B/binary, B/binary>>.
  203: 
  204: %% Ensure total is not truncated,
  205: %% as per https://github.com/erlang/otp/issues/8139
  206: call_memory_total(_Config) ->
  207:     ct:capture_start(),
  208:     ok = tprof:profile(?MODULE, lists_seq_loop, [10000], #{type => call_memory}),
  209:     ct:capture_stop(),
  210:     ?assertNotMatch(nomatch, re:run(ct:capture_get(), " 15000[01] ")),
  211:     ok.
  212: 
  213: sort() ->
  214:     [{doc, "Tests sorting methods work"}].
  215: 
  216: sort(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  217:     %% sort examples
  218:     ct:capture_start(),
  219:     ok = tprof:profile(
  220:         fun () ->
  221:             Group = lists:seq(100, 120),
  222:             rand:uniform(hd(Group))
  223:         end, #{report => {process, {measurement_per_call, descending}}, type => call_memory}),
  224:     ct:capture_stop(),
  225:     Out = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
  226:     %% measurement per call is 5th column
  227:     Col = 5,
  228:     Column5 = [string:to_integer(lists:nth(Col, Lexemes)) || Ln <- Out,
  229:         length(Lexemes = string:lexemes(Ln, " ")) >= Col],
  230:     WPC = [Words || {Words, []} <- Column5],
  231:     %% ensure descending sort
  232:     ?assertEqual(lists:reverse(lists:sort(WPC)), WPC).
  233: 
  234: rootset() ->
  235:     [{doc, "Tests rootset of processes supplied to ad-hoc profiler"}].
  236: 
  237: rootset(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  238:     TestCase = random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME),
  239:     {ok, Scope} = pg:start_link(TestCase),
  240:     Fun = fun () -> ok = pg:join(TestCase, lists:seq(1, 2), self()) end,
  241:     %% rootset tests
  242:     {ok, Profile} = tprof:profile(Fun, #{rootset => [TestCase], report => return, type => call_memory}),
  243:     TwoProcs = tprof:inspect(Profile),
  244:     ?assertEqual(2, maps:size(TwoProcs)), %% must be pg and "profiled process"
  245:     %% now trace all processes, existing and new
  246:     {ok, ProfAll} = tprof:profile(Fun, #{rootset => all, report => return, type => call_memory}),
  247:     %% at least tprof, pg2 and new profiled processes are traced
  248:     ?assert(map_size(tprof:inspect(ProfAll)) >= 3),
  249:     gen_server:stop(Scope).
  250: 
  251: set_on_spawn() ->
  252:     [{doc, "Tests tprof running with extra spawned processes"}].
  253: 
  254: set_on_spawn(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  255:     %% profile a function that spawns additional process
  256:     {done, Profile} = tprof:profile(
  257:         fun () ->
  258:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
  259:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
  260:         end, #{report => return, set_on_spawn => false, type => call_memory}),
  261:     ct:log("~p",[Profile]),
  262:     {done, ProfileMFA} = tprof:profile(?MODULE, seq, [32],
  263:                                        #{report => return,
  264:                                          set_on_spawn => false,
  265:                                          type => call_memory}),
  266: 
  267:     ct:log("~p",[ProfileMFA]),
  268:     %% check totals
  269:     #{all := {call_memory, _G1, TotalProfile}} = tprof:inspect(Profile, total, measurement),
  270:     #{all := {call_memory, _G2, TotalProfileMFA}} = tprof:inspect(ProfileMFA, total, measurement),
  271:     %% only 1 process must be there
  272:     ?assertEqual(1, maps:size(tprof:inspect(Profile)), {set_on_spawn, Profile}),
  273: 
  274:     DownMsgSz =
  275:         case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  276:             8 -> 9;
  277:             4 -> 10
  278:         end,
  279:     DownMsgSzFl = DownMsgSz * 1.0,
  280:     %% check per-process stats
  281:     ?assertMatch({?MODULE, {_, 0}, 1, DownMsgSz, DownMsgSzFl, _}, lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, TotalProfile)),
  282: 
  283:     %% MFA takes 4 more words. The memory of the 'DOWN' message is a bit racy,
  284:     %% so sometimes it will be there or not.
  285:     MfaSz = 4,
  286:     ?assertMatch({?MODULE, {seq, 1}, 1, Sz, SzAvg, _}
  287:                  when Sz =:= (DownMsgSz + MfaSz) andalso SzAvg == (DownMsgSz + MfaSz);
  288:                       Sz =:= MfaSz andalso SzAvg == MfaSz,
  289:                       lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, TotalProfileMFA)).
  290: 
  291: seq(Max) ->
  292:     {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, Max) end),
  293:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end.
  294: 
  295: live_trace() ->
  296:     [{doc, "Tests memory tracing for pre-existing processes"}].
  297: 
  298: live_trace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  299:     {ok, Srv} = start_link(Config, #{type => call_memory}),
  300:     Pid = spawn_link(
  301:         fun () ->
  302:             receive
  303:                 {From, C} ->
  304:                     [lists:seq(1, 2) || _ <- lists:seq(1, C)],
  305:                     From ! {self(), done}
  306:             end
  307:         end),
  308:     _ = set_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, '_', '_'),
  309:     1 = enable_trace(Config, Srv, Pid),
  310:     Pid ! {self(), 12},
  311:     receive {Pid, done} -> ok end,
  312:     catch disable_trace(Config, Srv, Pid),
  313:     Profile = collect(Config, Srv),
  314:     ProcInspected = tprof:inspect(Profile),
  315:     %% white box check: list comprehension with 1-arity, and 100% allocation
  316:     %% tprof:format(user, ProcInspected),
  317:     #{Pid := {call_memory, 48, [{?MODULE, {_LC, 1}, 13, 48, _, 100.0}]}} = ProcInspected,
  318:     stop(Config, Srv).
  319: 
  320: patterns() ->
  321:     [{doc, "Tests pattern enable/disable correctness"}].
  322: 
  323: patterns(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  324:     {ok, Srv} = start_link(Config, #{type => call_memory}),
  325:     %% test errors
  326:     ?assertEqual({error, {not_traced, pg, get_members, '_'}}, clear_pattern(Config, Srv, pg, get_members, '_')),
  327:     ?assertEqual({error, {trace_pattern, ?MODULE, seq, 2}}, set_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, seq, 2)),
  328:     %% successful patterns
  329:     1 = set_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, seq, 1),
  330:     3 = set_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, pattern_fun, '_'),
  331:     1 = clear_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, pattern_fun, 2),
  332:     Expected = [{pattern_fun, 1}, {pattern_fun, 3}, {seq, 1}],
  333:     ?assertEqual(#{?MODULE => Expected}, get_trace_map(Config, Srv)),
  334:     %% verify tracing flags
  335:     verify_trace(Srv, [{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Expected], [{?MODULE, pattern_fun, 2}]),
  336:     %% trace the entire ?MODULE module, and then exclude pattern_fun/1,2,3 and seq/1
  337:     _ = set_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, '_', '_'),
  338:     3 = clear_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, pattern_fun, '_'),
  339:     1 = clear_pattern(Config, Srv, ?MODULE, seq, 1),
  340:     Cleared = [{pattern_fun, 1}, {pattern_fun, 2}, {pattern_fun, 3}, {seq, 1}],
  341:     Traced = ?MODULE:module_info(functions) -- Cleared,
  342:     verify_trace(Srv, [{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Traced], [{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Cleared]),
  343:     %% clear all, which clears lists too
  344:     _ = clear_pattern(Config, Srv, '_', '_', '_'),
  345:     verify_trace(Srv, [], [{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Traced ++ Cleared]),
  346:     ?assertEqual(#{}, get_trace_map(Config, Srv)),
  347: 
  348:     %% Trace the entire node then exclude pattern_fun/1,2,3 and seq/1
  349:     _ = set_pattern(Config, Srv, '_', '_', '_'),
  350:     ?assertEqual(all, get_trace_map(Config, Srv)),
  351: 
  352:     stop(Config, Srv).
  353: 
  354: verify_trace(Srv, On, Off) ->
  355:     [?assertEqual({call_memory, []}, trace:info(tprof:get_session(Srv),MFA, call_memory)) || MFA <- On],
  356:     [?assertEqual({call_memory, false}, trace:info(tprof:get_session(Srv),MFA, call_memory)) || MFA <- Off].
  357: 
  358: pattern_fun(Any) -> Any.
  359: pattern_fun(Any, Any2) -> {Any, Any2}.
  360: pattern_fun(Any, Any2, Any3) -> {Any, Any2, Any3}.
  361: 
  362: processes() ->
  363:     [{doc, "Tests that process management for enabling/disabling traces works"}].
  364: 
  365: processes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  366: 
  367:     {ok, Srv} = start_link(Config),
  368: 
  369:     Pid = spawn_link(fun spawn_loop/0),
  370:     Pid2 = spawn_link(fun spawn_loop/0),
  371:     Name = random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME),
  372:     register(Name, Pid2),
  373:     %% test a mix of pids/registered processes/single PID calls
  374:     ?assertEqual(2, enable_trace(Config, Srv, [Pid, Name])),
  375:     ?assertEqual(0, disable_trace(Config, Srv, '$sure_not_exist')),
  376:     ?assertEqual({1, ['$sure_not_exist']}, enable_trace(Config, Srv, [Pid, '$sure_not_exist'])),
  377:     ok = gen:stop(Pid),
  378:     ok = gen:stop(Name),
  379: 
  380:     stop(Config, Srv).
  381: 
  382: server() ->
  383:     [{doc, "Tests for gen_server-based API"}].
  384: 
  385: server(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  386:     Name = random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME),
  387: 
  388:     %% start an extra pg scope - we'll trace it during profiling
  389:     {ok, Scope} = pg:start_link(Name),
  390:     %% simulate existing process
  391:     Pid = spawn_link(fun spawn_loop/0),
  392:     %% start the profiler
  393:     {ok, _Srv} = tprof:start_link(#{type => call_memory}),
  394:     %% test that ad-hoc profile can be run
  395:     ?assertEqual(ok, tprof:profile(fun() -> lists:seq(1,10) end)),
  396:     %% test live trace
  397:     1 = tprof:set_pattern(?MODULE, dispatch, '_'),
  398:     _ = tprof:set_pattern(pg, '_', '_'),
  399:     %% watch for pg traces and for our process
  400:     2 = tprof:enable_trace([Pid, Name]),
  401:     %% run the traced operation
  402:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, join, [Name, group, Pid]}),
  403:     %% collect profile (can save it to a file for later analysis)
  404:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  405:     %% must not be empty, and must contain 3-words dispatch from this module,
  406:     %%  and at least something from pg in two processes
  407:     ?assertNotEqual([], FirstProfile),
  408:     ?assertEqual({?MODULE, dispatch, 2, [{Pid, 1, 3}]}, lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, FirstProfile)),
  409:     ?assertMatch({pg, handle_call, 3, [{Scope, _, _}]}, lists:keyfind(handle_call, 2, FirstProfile)),
  410:     ?assertMatch({pg, join, 3, [{Pid, _, _}]}, lists:keyfind(join, 2, FirstProfile)),
  411:     %% pause tracing
  412:     ok = tprof:pause(),
  413:     %% ensure paused by running more code but keeping the trace
  414:     %% ensure collection still returns the previous result
  415:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, join, [Name, group, Pid]}),
  416:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  417:     %% continue, ensure new results are collected
  418:     ok = tprof:continue(),
  419:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, leave, [Name, group, [Pid, Pid]]}),
  420:     ?assertNotEqual({call_memory, FirstProfile}, tprof:collect()),
  421:     %% restart all counters from zero and ensure that we again collect the original data
  422:     ok = tprof:restart(),
  423:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, join, [Name, group, Pid]}),
  424:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  425: 
  426:     %% test ad-hoc profiling can be done while running server-aided
  427:     %% for that, profiler should have very specific pattern
  428:     {_, AdHoc} = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 32], #{registered => false, pattern => {lists, '_', '_'},
  429:         report => return, type => call_memory}),
  430:     %% check totals: must be 64 words allocated by a single lists:seq_loop
  431:     ?assertMatch(#{all := {call_memory, 64, [{lists, _, _, 64, _, _}]}},
  432:                  tprof:inspect(AdHoc, total, measurement)),
  433:     %% verify that server-aided version still works
  434:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  435:     ok = tprof:stop(),
  436:     ok = gen_server:stop(Scope),
  437:     ok = gen:stop(Pid).
  438: 
  439: %% nano-gen-server purely for tracing
  440: spawn_loop() ->
  441:     receive
  442:         {'$gen_call', From, Call} ->
  443:             dispatch(Call, From),
  444:             spawn_loop();
  445:         {system, From, {terminate,normal}} ->
  446:             gen:reply(From, ok)
  447:     end.
  448: 
  449: dispatch({spawn_link, Fun}, From) ->
  450:     gen:reply(From, erlang:spawn_link(Fun));
  451: dispatch({apply, M, F, A}, From) ->
  452:     gen:reply(From, erlang:apply(M, F, A)).
  453: 
  454: hierarchy() ->
  455:     [{doc, "Tests tracing for process hierarchy"}].
  456: 
  457: hierarchy(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  458:     {ok, Srv} = start_link(Config, #{type => call_memory}),
  459:     Traced = case enable_trace(Config, Srv, {all_children, kernel_sup}, #{ set_on_spawn => false }) of
  460:                  {T, _} -> T;
  461:                  T -> T
  462:              end,
  463:     ?assert(Traced > 5),
  464:     ?assert(set_pattern(Config, Srv, code_server, '_', '_') > 5),
  465:     _ = code:get_path(), %% makes a call to code_server
  466:     %% disabling all processes tracing should return more than "children of"
  467:     Disabled = disable_trace(Config, Srv, all),
  468:     ct:log("~p",[{Disabled, Traced}]),
  469:     ?assert(Disabled > Traced),
  470:     {call_memory, Profile} = collect(Config, Srv),
  471:     stop(Config, Srv),
  472:     ?assertNotEqual(false, lists:keyfind(handle_call, 2, Profile)).
  473: 
  474: code_reload() ->
  475:     [{doc, "Tests that collection does not fail for a hot-code-reloaded module"}].
  476: 
  477: code_reload(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  478:     {_, {call_memory, Sample}} = tprof:profile(
  479:                                    fun () -> msacc:start(100), code:load_file(msacc) end,
  480:                                    #{report => return, type => call_memory}),
  481:     %% don't care about actual returned values, but do care that profile/2 does not crash
  482:     ?assertNotEqual([], Sample).
  483: 
  484: code_load() ->
  485:     [{doc, "Tests profiling works for modules loaded during profiling"}].
  486: 
  487: code_load(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  488:     code:purge(sofs),
  489:     code:delete(sofs),
  490:     {_, {call_memory, Sample}} =
  491:         tprof:profile(fun () -> sofs:relation([{b,1},{c,2},{c,3}]) end,
  492:                       #{report => return, type => call_memory}),
  493:     ?assertNotEqual(false, lists:keyfind(sofs, 1, Sample)).
  494: 
  495: -define(SESSION(A, B),
  496:         case proplists:get_value(session, Config) of
  497:             undefined ->
  498:                 A;
  499:             _Session ->
  500:                 B
  501:         end).
  502: 
  503: start_link(Config) ->
  504:     ?SESSION(
  505:        tprof:start_link(),
  506:        tprof:start_link(#{ session => _Session })).
  507: 
  508: start_link(Config, Opts) ->
  509:     ?SESSION(
  510:        tprof:start_link(Opts),
  511:        tprof:start_link(Opts#{ session => _Session })).
  512: 
  513: set_pattern(Config, Srv, Mod, Fun, Arg) ->
  514:     ?SESSION(
  515:        tprof:set_pattern(Mod, Fun, Arg),
  516:        tprof:set_pattern(Srv, Mod, Fun, Arg)
  517:       ).
  518: 
  519: clear_pattern(Config, Srv, Mod, Fun, Arg) ->
  520:     ?SESSION(
  521:        tprof:clear_pattern(Mod, Fun, Arg),
  522:        tprof:clear_pattern(Srv, Mod, Fun, Arg)
  523:       ).
  524: 
  525: enable_trace(Config, Srv, Spec) ->
  526:     ?SESSION(
  527:        tprof:enable_trace(Spec),
  528:        tprof:enable_trace(Srv, Spec, [])
  529:       ).
  530: 
  531: enable_trace(Config, Srv, Spec, Opts) ->
  532:     ?SESSION(
  533:        tprof:enable_trace(Spec, Opts),
  534:        tprof:enable_trace(Srv, Spec, Opts)
  535:       ).
  536: 
  537: disable_trace(Config, Srv, Spec) ->
  538:     ?SESSION(
  539:        tprof:disable_trace(Spec),
  540:        tprof:disable_trace(Srv, Spec, [])
  541:       ).
  542: 
  543: collect(Config, Srv) ->
  544:     ?SESSION(
  545:        tprof:collect(),
  546:        tprof:collect(Srv)
  547:       ).
  548: 
  549: get_trace_map(Config, Srv) ->
  550:     ?SESSION(
  551:        tprof:get_trace_map(),
  552:        tprof:get_trace_map(Srv)
  553:       ).
  554: 
  555: stop(Config, Srv) ->
  556:     ?SESSION(
  557:        tprof:stop(),
  558:        tprof:stop(Srv)
  559:       ).
  560: 
  561: random_name(Prefix) ->
  562:     list_to_atom(atom_to_list(Prefix) ++ "__" ++ integer_to_list(erlang:unique_integer())).
  563:
